lines.text: [after being paid a complement by an opponent]
Now I know what a pancake feels like after it's had syrup poured all over it.
You hear what I hear? Kennedy's gonna name his brother Attorney General. Our friend J. Edgar says it's gonna be "Get Hoffa and get Cohn." Fuck the little cocksucker, and all the ships at sea.
Have you no decency, sir? At long last, have you no sense of decency?

Until this moment, I never really gauged your recklessness, or your cruelty. Fred Fisher is beginning what looks to be a brilliant career with us. And when I asked him to come here and assist us, he told me in college he briefly belonged to the Lawyer's Guild, the organization to which you refer. I told him that, um, I just don't think I'm going to use you on this case, because it might go out on the networks, and that would just hurt like the dickens. So, Senator, I sent him back to Boston. Little did I dream that you would be so cruel, and so reckless as to do injury to this lad. It's true, he works for us. It's true that he will continue to work for us, and it's true I fear he will always bear a scar needlessly inflicted by YOU. Let us not assassinate this lad any further, Senator? You've done enough! Have you no sense of decency, sir, at long last? Have you NO sense of DECENCY?
If you are a friend of Americas enemies, then you're an enemy too.
You're telling this boy how to live? You are?
That's the idea.

[firmly]
Don't. He's MINE. This is one boy they're NEVER going to forget!

[screaming at nurse]
You're the angel of death, but you're no fucking angel!
[Roy is fighting AIDS]
Slow down... stop... eating... me.
[the ghost of Ethel Rosenberg visits Roy in his deathbed]
Here's a secret, boychick. The electricity makes everything brighter. I could see. All the Jews were afraid because if you could kill me, all the Jews would die.

[to Peter]
They tried to kill me. The bastards didn't make it, though.
[points to the window]

What do you see there? You see the SUN! They have this one doctor. They PAID him to kill me. They couldn't do it themselves, the miserable cocksuckers... They got him to do it. You don't think so? My friends hate me. My enemies hate me. Now you hate me. Everybody hates me.

[interrupting]
You knocked off your enemies a long time ago and your friends love you. You know that.

Senator, I've seen enough names working for Pat McCarran. You're going to be hauling up Jew after Jew... all those European names, and with a McCarthy and a Kennedy together, it's gonna look like an Irish/Catholic-run pogrom. That will discredit everything you do, and I know, because I'm a Jew.
But they're Communists. They betrayed the faith of the Fathers for this Socialist God of Iron. Now, that's the issue, not anti-Semitism.
That's NOT what your opposition will say. It's very hard sometimes to control what an issue really is, and if your enemies can find a way to twist your motives, believe me, they will do it.
[McCarthy and Cohn make a toast]
To the birth of Jesus.
Right. Another tough Jew.
Well, to me, a Commie Jew is as disgusting as a Nazi Jew would be to you.
"Murderer's Row"? Who said that? Who called us that? Who cares. It has a nice ring to it. Anyway, they haven't seen anything yet, have they?
So what's the indictment, Doctor? Theoretical? Principle? Personal? Give it a name.
I don't name names.
Well, we know them already, so what's the difference?

[to the older doctor]
You won't try to hurt me. You wanna know why? Because you're STILL afraid of me.
There are plenty of the shelves by subversives like Dashiel Hammett, but interestingly enough not a SINGLE copy of American Legion magazine!

[in German]
Mr. Cohn, you believe Hemingway is a Russian agent?
[British reporters are laughing at Roy Cohn and David Schine]

[laughing]
Are we to understand that The Maltese Falcon and The Thin Man are actually Maxist propaganda?

[mocking]
Mr. Cohn, is William Karl Marx or Trotsky would you say?

[mocking]
Is Asta Lenin or Engels?
Mr. Cohn, do you intend to burn the books?

[mocking]
Mr. Schine, have you READ the books?
Everybody starts out straight. I've never heard of anybody being BORN homosexual, have you? It's just... times goes by and... and sometimes I guess... it happens to them... without knowing it.
What are you trying to DO to me?
I'm trying to make a great man out of you.
are you now, or ever have been, a member of the Communist Party?
No, sir, I'm a Democrat!
Well, maybe I'm a little nearsighted. I cannot see the picture.
Yes, I do believe you have betrayed a certain nearsightedness...
Well, I would say I happen to know that Colonel Bradley had a good steak dinner that night and perhaps he was thinking about that.
If Bradley was thinking of a steak, Schine must have been considering a whole haunch of beef, wouldn't he?
[the ghost of Joseph Welch speaks to Cohn on his deathbed]
Well, how did I do, Mr. Cohn?
The trial is over. You got McCarthy... but you didn't get me.

You think you're on trial here? What would you be on trial for? And might I say, Mr. Cohn, for your sexual predilections I bear no grudge, no malice, nor for the hot, secret practices of your friends, not Mr. Hoover, not His Excellency the Cardinal. But shame, Mr. Cohn, for persecuting in public those who are no different than you.

[denying]
I'm not gay.
Suuuure. And you're dying of mumps.
[Roy Cohn leaves a drunk and censured Senator McCarthy]
I always tried to do the right thing.
The right thing? What a disaster! If for one day, everybody in Washington tried to do the "right thing", you'd come into both Houses of Congress, there'd be mass suicide!
Yeah, well, it didn't used to be that way.
Wait, are you trying to tell me something, Joe? What? What? That I caused this? I didn't invent dirty tricks.

[chuckles]
No, no, you didn't. You kind of just made them into an art form.
Hey, you ever listen to Bob and Ray... making fun of me? Awfully, awfully funny.

Barely more than 100,000 votes over 70 million cast. That, Mr. and Mrs. North and South America, is a squeaker. Opinion here? A rich, Irish kid with King Midas for a daddy has just proved that in this country, you can buy anything, including the White House.
[sour]
Good luck, America.
Okay Roy, I understand. You don't want Bobby Kennedy in your bedroom uninvited, do you?
I don't want Bobby Kennedy ANYWHERE.
Can you, uh... I got to go to court because they're gonna try to disbar me.
The hearings are over, darling, all over.
Did I win?
No!

[With disbelief]
No? They disbarred me?
Ooh, they did!

[Incredulously]
Unhh?
Why were you so naughty? Why?
Oh, I don't know!
Why? Why did you get me? Hmmm?
Because I was a woman?
No!
Because I was a Jew?
No! I killed you for the headlines! For the fuckin' headlines!
[last lines]
Well, at last he did something human. What was he saying?
He said "Tell me the name of the judge!"

We'd like you to describe the apparatus of your organization, those to whom you reported, what they told you to put in your books, others you may have seen at party meetings. And we'll expect you to testify to a certain amount of this in public session.
I know what you're thinking about, but it isn't so, no how. Contrariwise, if it was so, it might be, and if it were so, it would be, but as it isn't, it ain't That's logic.
Very funny.
